page.title: 02SWINDERBY PARISH COUNCIL.
page.content: Every 4 years 7 people are elected to be the{ Parish Council.} It is the link between the people County Council and Government. It meets monthly and appoints representatives for the Village Hall,School Governors and Poor Trust and its own Chairman. The{Parish {Clerk,}a paid employee, is also the treasurer. The council receives Â£2030 from the general rates collected by {North Kesteven District Council.}It is spent on litter bins, seats and caring for the grass verges, flower beds, the notice boards, and the general up keep and development of the Village. In April an open {Parish meeting }is held when the council tells the Parish about their activities. In 1985 the{Police }came to talk about their reorganisation, a film on Lincolnshire was shown, tea and biscuits were served and 40 people were present.
